bug.author: AlexTraan
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenVINO=> ❔ Operating System / Platform => ❔ Compiler => ❔ Problem classification => ❔
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
Hi, When i call "self._exec_net.infer(inputs={self._input_blob: frame})", i faced error: "res = self._exec_net.infer(inputs={self._input_blob: frame}) File "ie_api.pyx", line 827, in openvino.inference_engine.ie_api.ExecutableNetwork.infer File "ie_api.pyx", line 1117, in openvino.inference_engine.ie_api.InferRequest.infer File "ie_api.pyx", line 1119, in openvino.inference_engine.ie_api.InferRequest.infer File "ie_api.pyx", line 1265, in openvino.inference_engine.ie_api.InferRequest._fill_inputs ValueError: could not broadcast input array from shape (1,3,229,229) into shape (1,3,299,299)" i dont know why failed in here when two shape match, can anyone help me? <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h5>Issue submission checklist</denchmark-h>
I report the issue, it's not a question
I checked the problem with documentation, FAQ, open issues, Stack Overflow, etc and have not found solution
There is reproducer code and related data files: images, videos, models, etc.
